website_summaries.verdict: The best value. You won't find a more well-rounded and sturdy laptop bag in this price range.
pros: Garners praise for its spacious 17-inch interior and unique organization panel
cons: Subpar quality zipper makes zippered pocket difficult to use
A bit bulky, but this may be acceptable if price and space are your top priorities

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: A decent backpack, fits my Alienware 17. Plenty of room in the main compartment, with a smaller pencil pouch and a fourth pocket for a mouse. The netting on the left side isn't really big enough to fit my Nalgene, so I just stuff my water bottle in the backpack. The problem with this backpack is that, while it fits 17" laptops, it isn't sturdy enough to carry them around. After four months of use, the stitching in the bottom right corner has come undone, making about a 2 inch hole. It's a shame, because this is the least obnoxious-looking backpack I could find that will fit an alienware 17. Maybe I'll give SwissGear a shot...
customer_reviews.author: famulan

customer_reviews.title: Great budget backpack
customer_reviews.text: I got this because none of my other backpacks could fit my 17" MSI gs75 stealth. It has some padding for the laptop compartment, and it is able to fit a power brick, game controller and a lot of stuff while still maintaining a somewhat slim profile. My only gripe is that I would like to have some padding on the bottom of the laptop compartment and not just the sides. But for the price, I really can't complain much. I ended up placing a rolled up t shirt on the bottom for cushion. All in all, a great budget backpack. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Good capacity, not really rain resistant at all
customer_reviews.text: This was my main backpack for a few years. Good capacity, not really rain resistant at all. The netting on the outside pocket ripped soon after purchasing, which was okay as I didn't really use it. The zipper on the small back pocket broke also. Finally, the area where the bottom left strap connects is also starting to rip, leaving a hole in the pocket closest to your back. I used it for groceries though, and sometimes the load would get high, but never more than 30lbs. Kind of flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Hall

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good backpack, can fit everything I need for college daily, fits my computer. Straps can kinda hurt and the bags back could be softer, but you can't beat the value. I just wish there was padding on the bottom of the laptop compartment so my laptop would be safe when I place the backpack down. I do like the padding on both sides of the computer compartment I just wish it was on the bottom. I might just put some foam down there and it'll be perfect. My 15.6" laptop fits perfectly. And is relatively safe.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Slim.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this Case Logic backpack for seven years now, use it weekly, and it is still going strong after being in the majority of the states and eight countries. I also have the neopreme laptop case by Case Logic for my 17" screen which fits perfectly in the back portion of the bag and gives it extra protection. I own three Case Logic cases and they are all still in use after years of service.
customer_reviews.author: The Tally Ho

customer_reviews.title: Professional, sleek - while carrying on your back.
customer_reviews.text: 8 months in this backpack. Not bad. the exterior has held up very well. sans a little pulling when i brushed up against a cement wall. but now a seam is busting out. i knew the backpack was smaller than my previous ones. i now carry an additional canvas bag. bag is small enough that it can't be over loaded. good computer protection - but needs a bottom cushion in the laptop compartment. very professional looking, no mistaking this for a day pack.
customer_reviews.author: Happ

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this bag-pack for 6 years. On a rainy day your naturals will not get wet but the outside of the bag-pack will be soaked. I’ve carried text books, note books, and a laptop all at the same time. It has cushion so it’s comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Rosio Mujica

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good bag...BUT
customer_reviews.text: Good bag, haven't put it through it's test at the airport but will update when I do. Everything seems to fit okay. UPDATE: Used it this Christmas for traveling....The inside lining separated from the outside protective cover, not a good experience for it's first use. I'm out of luck now since it's past it's return time & am out the $23 dollars it cost me. Not a happy camper. Amazon where are you??? Downgraded to 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: better than you;d think....
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because the backpack that I was traveling with didn't feel like it was cutting it....I ordered this thinking it was bigger. When it arrived I was worried...however-it holds more than it looks like it can-and zips easiiy...I stuffed my laptop, full sized ac pack, a dvd player, my kiindle-in a padded tablet case, all power supplies and cords-over the ear headphones-pens, magazines, dvds in cases..and-the way it is designed-no matter how full, I could easily pull the zippers closed...not like when you over stuff other bags or back packs where there's a point where you have to pull it over the load....and as a backpack it actually is comfortable to wear. So -inexpensive and very useful...
customer_reviews.author: kpdrumswritessings

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack!
customer_reviews.text: Great back pack! Love it. Car ruses my Dell 6520 laptop and college material + external he'd and loads of otters stuff. My normal load I carry Dell 6520 laptop w/ power cord. 10ft power cord in case no seat close to outlet. 2-or-3 2inch binders for college. Compact 3 hole paper punch bar. Ear buds cord. 2 Ext hhd w/ sub cables. 3 thumb drives. 6-10 pens, mechanical pencils, highlighters. Extra iPhone charger+ cable. 1to 3 Huge IT books. It can take rough handling too. Laptop area is padded. Back pack is great investment in yourself, get it!
customer_reviews.author: Rich R

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Laptop Bag
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my work computer, I commute about an hour on public transportation. It has held up great, keeps my computer very safe, and is really comfortable. I can load it up and it feels like nothing on my back. I'm really impressed, especially for the reasonable price. Update: After a year and a half of really heavy use, this bag is just reaching the end of its lifespan. It's really been incredible; I have carried it home on my bike literally bursting with groceries and it's held up like a champ. It's still alive now, just a bit dirty and misshapen​, and I tore the mesh water bottle holder with my keys.
customer_reviews.author: santi

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this backpack for almost a year now and could not be more satisfied with it. I'm definitely not careful with it but it still looks brand new. It has three spacious pouches, one being for laptop storage, and a small front pocket for phone/keys/etc. I am very satisfied with it. I have a 16" laptop, which fits perfectly in the back pouch, and I store all my other school supplies, also, with no problem. My only complaint is that it is not waterproof by any means, so if it is raining, make sure you use proper protection for anything valuable inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best bag I've ever owned and lasted me nearly 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: I write this as I lay my old boy down to rest from a tragic washing machine accident. Probably the best bag I've ever owned and lasted me nearly 6 years. Kept my laptops over the years safe through college, and it's big enough for some snacks, too. If you're looking for a simple bag to tote around a laptop you can stop looking, because you've found it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Roman

customer_reviews.title: Way better than a purse.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a computational linguist, so I need to bring my company-issued laptop back and forth to work every day. This backpack has plenty of room for that, plus my notebooks, folders, and personal items that I'd normally carry in a purse. For the price, it's astonishingly well-made; I'd put it on the same level as a North Face backpack I had as an undergrad. It's a sleek, simple design, which makes it well-suited to my workplace. If you need to safely transport a laptop on your daily commute, look no further. You can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: SRP

customer_reviews.title: Adequate, but lacking important features.
customer_reviews.text: The laptop zipper on runs from one side of the top down the bottom of the other side making removal a 17" laptop challenging. There is only one side expanding pocket area. There is no caribiner or key chain hook areas. The laptop section does not have a divider to separate the laptop from related stuff you may want to put in that section. I am very, very disappointed. The material does appear durable enough, the hand grip is perfect for a woman's smaller hands, and the straps are comfortable and work well.
customer_reviews.author: Just Outside No Where

customer_reviews.title: TEACHER approved!
customer_reviews.text: Its awesome!. I have a huge 17inch laptop because I do both at home and work with the same laptop and it fits perfectly. i also have plenty of room for about five heavily stuffed folders, and space for accessories. i put my laptop cord on top of the folders and everything fits perfect. Its a great thin design that it also is aesthically appealing. Its not padded a lot to prevent damage from a hard fall, but it is decent enough for everyday use and transfer from floor to back. GREAT PRICE TOO! These bags are very pricey normally. Very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BEST BACKPACK EVER
customer_reviews.text: This backpack costs so little but feels like a million bucks. I was using an old backpack, and it felt like 80 pounds, I put everything I had on my old backpack to this one and it feels weightless. Its so comfortable. Comfortableness: 10/10 It's sleek and very comfortable on the shoulders. Its very soft. Space: 10/10 I have my laptop, my textbooks, my electronics, and I still have space for more. There is so much space it feels light too. Organization: 8/10 One of the compartments has pockets for organization. But it's good enough. If you are a student who has to lug a laptop everywhere. BUY THIS! SAVE YOUR BACK FROM THE DESPAIR!
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: It's done the job.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 17" Dell Inspiron a few years ago. It holds a 17" laptop well. Only problem I have is stuff getting lost in the other pockets because it's so long. Mine hasn't had hard wear or use, but is still going strong after the laptop died.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Way sturdier than it has any right to be.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack a couple of years ago, and it hasn't suffered any rips or tears under normal use. Looks unassuming, but it's packed with features and enough space to easily accommodate a 17-inch laptop. A great buy for anyone in the market for a sturdy backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: May actually be bigger on the inside than the outside...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack to carry my work laptop between home and the office. The laptop has its own section, my lunch fits in the middle compartment, and there's a smaller compartment that fits my iPad and daily planner along with some pens. The mesh water bottle holder handles my 40oz Klean Kanteen just fine. This weekend I took my laptop out and tossed in a board game to take to a friend's place. It fit with room to spare. I really like the slim profile. The backpack I bought this to replace was very bulky. This one still holds everything I need it to without ever looking overstuffed.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what it needs to be for the price
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't exactly look great or stylish, but it's very functional. It has plenty of well-padded compartments for two laptops (I assume, I only carry one and sometimes an iPad for my commute into the city). It's not at all bulky and has got a slim profile and doesn't take up a lot of space behind me which is crucial as someone who rides the crowded NYC subway with it. I can get all the stuff I need for my commute in there: laptop, iPad, lunch, spare headphones, spare charger for the laptop, umbrella, a book. It's not cavernous in there or anything, but for the average commuter it's probably perfect.
customer_reviews.author: J. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Nice and professional looking
customer_reviews.text: Nice and professional looking. It's been holding up well. Fine for typical everyday use, the only downside I could say is that it obviously won't hold up to the strain of an extremely heavy load - the stiching around the zippers seems to stretch easily. I wouldn't push its limits with a bunch of large heavy college textbooks. Update: It finally ripped, I pushed it too far. Was a decent bag, will be upgrading to a more heavy duty bag.
customer_reviews.author: Somepersononline

customer_reviews.title: Slim, perfect and Light
customer_reviews.text: When I upgraded my laptop from a 15" to a 17'3, I knew that I would need a new laptop bag however I was afraid that a bag to fit a 17.3 laptop would be bulky. My concerns were incorrect. This laptop bag is both slim and light but also has the capability of having a high capacity for holding books and other items all at the same time while protecting your computer. My recommendation is to purchase this laptop bag for your computer. It is not only efficient, ergonomic and light but also well priced. A great purchase. Thinking about purchasing another to put in storage for the future. CP
customer_reviews.author: Islandson

customer_reviews.title: Best Laptop Backpack
customer_reviews.text: I got this backpack because I am a college student and I was tired of carrying around a laptop bag as well as my backpack. I bought this for around $30, and for that it is a great deal. My laptop is a 15.6 inch laptop, I bought a 17 inch laptop backpack just so I know everything will fit(which it does). At first I had the issue that not everything was fitting how I would like it to, just because I carry a lot of things, but after a little organization everything fit(chargers, external hard drive, mouse, etc). I would recommend this backpack to anyone. Best purchase I've made in a while.
customer_reviews.author: nerfezoriuq

customer_reviews.title: Quite possibly my favorite backpack ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to accommodate a 17 inch MacBook Pro. It is a very slim bag overall, but can carry countless amounts of clothing, books, accessories, electronics... I have used it on multiple trips for several days, as my one traveling bag. Definitely used it for a couple of years, and I only recently got rid of it after selling my 17 inch laptop, and when a tiny hole developed in the bottom corner of the laptop Portion of the backpack. I absolutely loved this bag, and was sad to see it go. eBags was a great investment and a good company to buy future backpacks from.
customer_reviews.author: video007man

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for a backpack!
customer_reviews.text: First off, the price is AMAZING for the quality of this backpack! I understand how some people may say after you fill the front pouch and have a laptop in there, there isn't a whole lot of room for books in the middle compartment, but honestly i don't want that much weight on my back anyway. This schoolbag is convenient enough to hold everything i need at all times and then i just switch out the heavy books from my car when i need them or carry the textbook to class, but the middle compartment holds about 3 notebooks which is all i need at one time. The straps are extremely comfortable and overall i love it!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my surface pro 7
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my surface pro 7; fits everything plus a mouse, paper, wallet just fine. The strap isn’t my favourite but it works great for school.
customer_reviews.author: Zacc

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag, well padded!
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack! It has ample space for two thick books, a notebook, a laptop, charger and pencils. The ample padding protects my computer (it really means something when it comes from a klutz like me!) and makes sure I don't damage it. I love the straps. They are very ergonomically designed and provide support to the shoulders and the back. I don't know why so many people had problems with their piece because I've been using this bag for the past three months and haven't had any problem with it. Bottom line: highly recommend it for college!
customer_reviews.author: Vaish

customer_reviews.title: Fits Everything
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. After reading a few reviews I decided to buy it hoping it would fit my sister's 17.5 inch HP laptop. it is the widescreen version and after looking for over 6 months at every department store and online store I could. I finally came across this one and took my chances. It works wonderfully. She still has room in the pocket and it is so well made that she can fit it in either of the two pockets and the laptop will be safe. Comfortable to wear and even can hold her heavy medical school books and the laptop. Only had it for two weeks. no complaints. will update if any problems arise.
customer_reviews.author: Aaliyah

customer_reviews.title: Large, but not obnoxious.
customer_reviews.text: Great on space. It's large and not overbearing. I am a 5'2" petit female with lots of things to carry at once. There are plenty of compartments and it holds everything I use. I have two large textbooks that I walk around with, my laptop (MacBook Air), a graphing calculator, two large notebooks, and a folder. Sometimes I have loads of paperwork from work to bring home. I can take my school stuff with me to work To study on down time. This makes life so much easier!
customer_reviews.author: P.

customer_reviews.title: Great laptop backpack, but no padding on bottom
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these backpacks (one for me, one for wife) and they have been in use for quite some time now. Used daily and holding up very well. Good size for a carry-on bag. The only issue I have with the bag is the lack of padding on the bottom of the bag in the laptop compartment. The sides are well padded, but you need to be careful setting the bag down. I've banged my computer on the floor a few times. There is plenty of room in the pack, so would be easy enough to add a piece of foam or something, I just haven't bothered.
customer_reviews.author: Hardwater Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Great tech backpack!
customer_reviews.text: This backpack is GREAT for people with lots of tech. It has 3 main compartments; one for a laptop, a slightly smaller one for things such as tablets, headphones, etc., and one for chargers/ jackets. It is very light and small, and definitely does not make your back feel as heavy as some other backpacks do. My one complaint about this product is that it does not have a lot of smaller pockets or any pockets that can be zipped up, but it is still a great backpack. It is definitely a must-have backpack for people with tech, and its cheap price only makes it more attractive!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Case Logic VNB-217
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic Laptop Backpack. I've been looking for a nice case for my Dell 17.5 inch laptop for a long time. I was on vacation in Utah and the junk one I had broke. I took a chance, because I needed something to carry the Dell home in, on the Case Logic value 17-inch backpack. Super fantastic, hands free, tons of pockets,and I put the 17.5inch computer and a wireless key board in the computer pocket and zipped it shut! All this for 1/2 of what I was going to spend for a case. Thanks Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: dimitri44

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well, has plenty of room for laptop
customer_reviews.text: Just needed a simple bag to carry my laptop to work and back. Works pretty well, has plenty of room for laptop, charger, a couple other cables and a notepad and pens. It doesn't feel likes it's really high quality or anything but should hold up fine for what I use it for. If you're looking to carry your laptop on a bike ride or hiking or something I don't think this is the bag that you want. My only real complaint is that the shoulder straps are too short to wear it comfortably on my back, I'm a pretty big guy though.
customer_reviews.author: Neo

customer_reviews.title: Good for larger laptops
customer_reviews.text: I had a very hard time finding a lap-top bag or backpack that said it would fit a 17 inch laptop. I know everyone loves those tiny laptops and tablets but that's not what work gave me to travel with. This backpack fits my monster laptop and all the accessories, as well as some paper files. The multiple pockets are very useful. I like the water bottle holder. It has served me well for over a year and seems sturdy enough to keep going for a while. I lug it all over and throw it around in airport security - no issues.
customer_reviews.author: KDM

customer_reviews.title: Great little laptop backpack
customer_reviews.text: I use this pack everyday for work. It provided great protection for those who are pretty cautious with their laptop. I would question the ability to protect from a drop off the shoulder, but it is better than nothing. But to toss in the back seat or on a chair, it protects from scratches and dents. Has compartments for folders/paperwork and for accessories such as chargers, external hard drives and pens.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Best Backpack I ever bought for my computer!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a graphic design student and this backpack is the best product I ever bought to carry my computer. Inside there's so much padding to keep the computer safe and so much room in the other compartments for my books and supplies and much more. It's great for commuting to and from school. So much better than the one I bought from Best Buy, which was double the cost of this one and much less padding. I will definitely recommend this page to everyone I know for it's high quality and resemble price.
customer_reviews.author: Susan J

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I like this laptop case. There is a lot of room and pockets inside. The only thing I don't like is the biggest compartment (where you would put the computer) only zips around about 3/4 of the way, rather than being able to make the entire compartment open and close. It's hard to explain--basically when I open it, I keep expecting the zipper to keep going, but it stops at the top. There is probably a reason, like maybe it keeps the computer in better.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Carlin

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and well made
customer_reviews.text: not very bulky, weights only 1.35 pounds. overall good quality, but would have liked shoulder straps to have more padding. also, would have liked to have more padding in the floor of the laptop section. probably the best you can buy for under 25 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: RareReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpack for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This backpack doesn't have a ton of organizational space, but for the purposes I purchased it for, namely to carry my laptop and peripherals, it works great. I have a large 17.3" laptop and it fits perfectly in the back pouch. The middle section is great for my cables, and there's a pouch of front that I find perfect for my mouse. It feels made solid. If you want more organization, you might look for a different selection, but if you just want a nice backpack for your larger model laptops, than for the price, this backpack is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Dark Fairy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pack for a few years and I recently purchased one for my nephew. I travel weekly on planes and I carry the maximum amount of gear that this thing will fit. I have no worries about it ripping, breaking, or a zipper failing. This is the most solid backpack I have ever had. This is easily milspec, I run with it full of gear all the time and have no issues. I can't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Good quality zippers
customer_reviews.text: This bag has worked really well. Good quality zippers, and the pockets are easy to access and have what you need. Couple callouts: -The laptop section in the back doesn't have any strap to hold down the computer, so it has a bit of room to move around depending on the size of your laptop -The front pocket has sewed subsections that make it a bit more constricting that I'd like (I can't quite fit my kindle in it), but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: C.J. Horist

customer_reviews.title: Secure Carrier
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have to bring my lap top to and from work every day and I wanted something slim but protective. The design is nice and simple and it has a nice padded, secure area for my computer. Also, there are two other pockets for storage which are great if you have to carry around books. This would be a great purchase for students in college who have to carry around books, notebooks, writing utensils, and lap tops. You could easily fit all of that in this bag without it looking stuffed and sloppy.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H.

customer_reviews.title: perfect travel bag for nintendo wii
customer_reviews.text: all three zipped compartments have padding which makes it perfect for storing a game console. i can fit the wii power brick, usb ethernet and component cable in the front compartment. 1 wii classic gamepad, 4 wii motes, 4 nunchucks and 2 wii wheels in the middle compartment. then the console, console stand and a 48 cd/dvd case holder in the laptop compartment. my only gripe is that the compartment for the laptop does not fully open down the side of the backpack like the other two.
customer_reviews.author: Rommel

customer_reviews.title: this is a very nice back pack for an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: For a little over $20 spent this book bag is top of the line. I carry my surface pro 3 in it along with my physics and Spanish notebook, and it still has plenty of room to spare. If you are thinking of getting this for yourself or a child, this is a very nice back pack for an affordable price. Now the only question is whether it will last long., which if its anything like the month that Ive owned it, then I expect to be wearing this through graduate school.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't have chosen better
customer_reviews.text: This is the backpack I chose for my use when I bought my laptop. Since I have a 17.3 inch laptop, I couldn't go with just anything. My laptop fits perfectly, with room. I managed to get it, the cables, a portable mouse, 2 DVDs, a video game disk, 3 paperbacks, a sketchbook, pencils, and snacks into it when I flew to Florida in August 2012. The backpack held up without any issues. The straps were comfortable to wear, even with all that weight. It has held up extremely well.
customer_reviews.author: Kaidlen Shan/Traser

customer_reviews.title: What a nice change!
customer_reviews.text: What a nice change!!! Placing my lap top with a larger container on wheels was convenient if it wasn't raining or snowing as it tends to do sometimes in the pacific NW. But the investment of the backpack that allowed me to carry the pc and associated paperwork on my back, was a wonderful change. Now rain, snow or shine, I am hands free. The pack is built solid and the zippers are structurally sound. I am very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Enjoy the Journey

customer_reviews.title: Great bag if you dont have much to carry...
customer_reviews.text: The design of it is what made me purchase the backpack. It'll fit a 17" Laptop easy. You can also put a bunch of magazines or a couple of good size books and other misc flat items. PROS: - Pretty Sturdy - Nice design - Slim; not bulky - Front/Back area for laptop is well cushioned CONS: - Not a lot of inner pockets - Inner pockets are all open type. No place to hook keys. - No strap to secure laptop - Bottom of bag where the laptop sits is not as cushioned as the sides. Even with the cons I still don't regret buying the bag. Overall I'm pretty pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mont Santiago

customer_reviews.title: ... so when I saw this bag I know it's excellent quality, laptop fits good
customer_reviews.text: I have a case logic brand for my usb hard drive so when I saw this bag I know it's excellent quality, laptop fits good, padding all around so when I placed the bag I was not worried, it has padding at the bottom of the bag,smartly designed. I always like a shoulder strap bag first time I am trying a backpack, great value for money, recommended for travelers
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Loads of Space
customer_reviews.text: I needed a carrying case for my 14" Acer, and this fits the bill very well. The multiple pockets give it room to spare when packed with the laptop, power cable, bluetooth and trackball mice, headphones, earbuds, pens, pencils, papers, and basically the only limitation to this bag is one of weight. I wouldn't trust it with more than 20 lbs of things, which becomes a slight problem when your $1000+ load of tech spills into the street. For 20-30 bucks, there are very few better alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Lattens Elethiomel

customer_reviews.title: ...And the kitchen sink
customer_reviews.text: This bag is like my mini office. I have my 17 inch laptop, my ipad, 2 hard drives, 1 is portable so it's small and the other is about the length of a brick but not as thick as a brick. I have a 6 outlet adapter. A powerstrip for the car, my laptop power cord, mouse, portable speaker, battery charger, pens business cards, headphones, 25 blank CDs. All that and a little more fits into this bag. It's sturdy and shows no signs of wear and tear so far.
customer_reviews.author: Crystyl Clear

customer_reviews.title: Fit 17.3" Laptop Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Fit my Dell Precision 7710 with a little extra room, too. Perfect for work. Front pocket holds my writing utensils, wireless mouse, etc. Middle pocket is enough to hold some notebooks and file folders. This is perfect for work! Dimensions of the laptop: Height: (front) 1.12” (28.5mm) Height: (rear) 1.36” (34.49mm) | Width: 16.42” (417.04mm) | Depth: 11.08” (281.44mm) | Weight: (starts at) 7.55lbs (3.42kg)
customer_reviews.author: Sparty

customer_reviews.title: Super awesome
customer_reviews.text: every compartment is easily accessible. it can hold at least two laptops if needed (we have). Three decent sized pockets in the first zipper area. to store cords or a wireless mouse. A middle zipper to store the charger so you don't get it tangle up with other cords. and the back zipper has a padded area so any movement protects the laptop. The straps are padded so if you have to carry it long distances it won't hurt your shoulders.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far....so good....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who is going off to college. This back pack does fit my son's 17.3 inch laptop....though it will not fit much else in the other pockets because the back pack does not expand. But, he should be able to fit the cord and maybe a book and some pens. I hope some of his books are online. Otherwise, he won't be able to take them all to class on the days he has class all day. Because he has not used the backpack with books, I cannot comment on how sturdy it is.
customer_reviews.author: MizzTea

customer_reviews.title: so far its working
customer_reviews.text: This is my high tech toy bookbag. Ive got a few things in it that might sound funny but I wanted to see how much it could hold and its easier with all of it in one place. Now to a list of all the stuff I put into it. It holds my 15.6 inch laptop fine. Then I also have a blue-ray player and a 3 teriabite hard drive. A wireless mouse, 3 flash drive, a GPS unit, a mini digital camera. Some paper and a few pens. Not full yet but close.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D. Calvelage

customer_reviews.title: Backpack is roomy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to carry my work laptop and other items to and from work. Size is perfect. Straps are comfortable. Extremely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Kelly

customer_reviews.title: The backpack is super comfortable and has adequate storage space for organization
customer_reviews.text: The backpack provides OK protection to my Asus. My laptop is a 17.3" and it just barely fits in this backpack. I have to leave the top corner unzipped. The backpack is super comfortable and has adequate storage space for organization. I still like it and am overall satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: yanelle

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with everything that this backpack offers
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with everything that this backpack offers. It has lots of little compartments in the outer compartment. There are three separate zip ups making it easy to organize and store different items. I put my (15.6") laptop in the zip closest to me. I put my lunch/cups/etc. in the middle zip. Then, I put an ethernet cord, pens, headphones, change, flash drive, and a few other items in the outer zip. I'm glad I got the larger pack (even though I have a 15.6" laptop) so that I can store more.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag so far
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag so far. Pros: comfortable and lite, space for books and drawing pads, place for a water. Bargain price, awesome value. Cons: only complaint would be that the padding inside the laptop compartment does not wrap around the corners, so if your laptop bag falls of you onto its corners (very likely) you will only have a very thick canvas material between Mr. Laptop and Mr. asphalt. You should be ok.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer #01134

customer_reviews.title: great :)
customer_reviews.text: the product was delivered in proper packaging and in great condition.. there is padding for your back and the laptop area has 1/2 inch thick padding right around, even the underneath of the bag is padded too .. the bag handles the weight of text books, notebooks and my Alienware M14x easily and without looking too huge .. the bag straps are comfortable and supportive .. this was a great purchase, i would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Hex

customer_reviews.title: ... has lots of storage and doesn't make me look like I work in the Tech Industry
customer_reviews.text: This backpack has lots of storage and doesn't make me look like I work in the Tech Industry. It's durable and light weight compared to other backpacks I looked at. Plus, I'm not a huge fan of backpacks -- I bought this one because of it's clean design as a starter backpack and it's holding up fine so I'd likely buy again when / if this one gives out.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon G.

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: I love the Case Logic bags. This is the 4th one I've purchased (all different sizes). This review is for the 17" laptop backpack. My daughters large screen (17") laptop fits great in this bag. She has room in the main compartment for a few books and folders for school. The front pocket has a few small pockets and pen holders. There is plenty of room in the bag and good padding for her computer.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: The mesh that holds the water bottle tore easily but still holds my water bottle. It really is a great buy. It holds everything I need to take to school and work. Nice padding in the back to protect the laptop. The only knock on it is that I was the straps were more comfortable but that is just nit-picking. Great value, great buy. I would definitely purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Mikel

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT. STURDY. VALUE FOR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in 2013 through Amazon and I am coming back now in 2019 to write a review. Extremely well made and super sturdy. This should be the go to bag for work (takes laptop 15 inches easily)...this has served as my diaper bag, vacation bag, laptop bag. I would definitely recommend this bag.
customer_reviews.author: gdivya85

customer_reviews.title: nice laptop bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice laptop bag. It's smaller than expected but does the job. It holds a 17 inch laptop nicely with room for books and other items.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack
customer_reviews.text: My 17" laptop fits in this fine. Plenty of pockets etc. I bought it to take a business trip across the country and it worked great. It fit under the airplane seat.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon R

customer_reviews.title: Very light case with minor shortcomings.
customer_reviews.text: Has a lot of pockets and a very large holding area for the laptop it's self, my main complaint is that the bottom side is barely padded, if at all, so I have to be careful when lowering the pack on the ground, there is SOME padding...but barely. Otherwise everywhere else it is very well protected. The backback it's self is extremely light, which helps if you have a long walk ahead of you.
customer_reviews.author: Moe

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again...worth every penny spent!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. It holds my laptop and all accessories. I can also fit in paperwork my lunch and more. It has pockets in the front that are great for my cell phone, sunglasses and more. I use the smallest pocket for headphones and lip balm. I have crammed it full and it is still functioning great after months of carrying it. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Nice sized backpack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack with the intent of storing my laptop and its miscellaneous accessories. It stores all that and so much more. I like the cushion to the straps on the backpack considering I get a pinch in my neck and shoulder with bags that are weighted. I am also happy with the many compartments to hold pens, flash drive, debit card, and other materials which are small so I don't have to carry a pocketbook.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: must have
customer_reviews.text: fits my Dell 17" Precision M6800 Mobile Workstation. if you seen one you know its a tank and its heavy laptop. it fits easily in this bag and is supported well in it. bags feels good with all my gear in it. pockets are great it can hold my Gigabyte GM-FORCE M9 ICE Performance Wireless Laser Mouse and its a big mouse. this a great backpack that cant be touched at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Staphaine A. Staley

customer_reviews.title: Laptop backpack, pictures can be deceiving
customer_reviews.text: Bag is only a laptop bag, great for carrying your 17" laptop (if you still use something that big) and its accessories. It is very thin so spare set of clothes and a water bottle is not going to fit. Not ideal for long travelling. Another one of those laptop back packs from a laptop manufacturer. Material is good however I wish it had more space. Stress the bag with weight and seems will start to tear.
customer_reviews.author: Janitha J

customer_reviews.title: This is actually a better backpack than the price would suggest and handles a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a better backpack than the price would suggest and handles a 3 course semester at college perfectly. I carried 2 textbooks, my macbook air, 1 binder, and 2 notebooks without issues, including handling the weight rather skillfully despite some of the more expensive backpacks with more bell and whistle straps.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: sturdy product, suitable for travelling
customer_reviews.text: good quality product, storage capacity is less. Can be used for day-trips
customer_reviews.author: Sid Rao

customer_reviews.title: Perfect go-to bag for sudden backpacking needs
customer_reviews.text: After more than two years of everyday use (mostly office) it's still going strong, without a tear, zipper works perfectly, and the colors didn't change, in spite of having every kind of liquids spilled over and into it. I definitely recommend it, especially for light but frequent use.
customer_reviews.author: Kristof

customer_reviews.title: Great storage laptop case!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything so far. Hope it holds up to moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: Keyman12

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a nice slim backpack to carry my laptop, binders, folders, portable hard drive, card readers, etc. all three zipped compartments have padding which makes it perfect for storing a game console. Quality is good, as always, with Case Logic products. Easy to use,not bulky. Lots of extra space for wireless mouse and keyboard
customer_reviews.author: ANDY PATEL

customer_reviews.title: still going strong after 3.5 years
customer_reviews.text: I have had this backpack since 2013. It has been my daily backpack for work for the last 2 years and it is still going strong. Overtime some stitching on the straps came undone that I fixed easily. It holds a 17" laptop fine. I would recommend this backpack to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm

customer_reviews.title: I like the inner pockets that allow me to keep organized
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of this product. I like the inner pockets that allow me to keep organized. The only thing was the strap edges started to fray badly so I purchased a new one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Springer

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Affordable, stylish and sleek, good quality backpack that sits higher up on my back--I don't let out the straps--and so makes carrying a heavy load of laptop and books SO much easier. Not as many compartments as I'd like--why only one mesh pocket for my bottle, CaseLogic?--but definitely gets the job done. I'm decidedly happy with my purchase. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: vnikyt

customer_reviews.title: dont know what i was thinking
customer_reviews.text: i bought this bag thinking i would have room to keep a couple other things in there but its a tight fit. a nice bag if all you want to carry is a laptop and tablet, the large pocket might be four inches deep. i took off a star because the utility pockets are awkwardly shaped as well as the front zippered space which cant hold more than a few square cd cases. i probably just being too picky.
customer_reviews.author: k.

customer_reviews.title: Very functional, very handy.  Simple uncomplicated design.
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for over 2 years now, and I have not had a moment to think about a new one. Fits my 19" laptop perfectly and keeps it safe too. Love the small pocket it has in front of the bag. Its been very handy to stow my phone in there while I am traveling or even some quick jewelry or some snacks. I just love this backpack.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bapat

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice
customer_reviews.text: I brought this laptop bag for my High School Senior/Honor Student. It arrived within a few days. It was bigger than I thought wich is great. It fits his laptop and most of his huge books. I love the construction and sleek look. There are plenty of pockets and compartment which you really can't see in the picture. I think we will make it through the school year without this one tearing up.
customer_reviews.author: SheLuvsGodTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Solid but Simple
customer_reviews.text: I was wanting to replace my old laptop backpack with something simple and streamlined. I take my laptop home once a week, but otherwise it's empty. My laptop is 17", and it fits well. The padding on the straps and back is adequate. It is light. The handle at the top is only a simple strap. My main complaint is I could use a few more clips, cubbies, zippered comparments, etc. in the front section. With that said, this was an inexpensive bag so I shouldn't expect too much. It basically does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Jackson

customer_reviews.title: The heavy duty padded straps make it easy to load this thing up with 70 lbs of ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this bag as my carryon when I travel. I work from home and have to take my work with me. I fit a laptop, tablet, drawing tablet, phone, chargers and adapters, books, wallet, personal items and more in this backpack. The heavy duty padded straps make it easy to load this thing up with 70 lbs of crap and carry it effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this laptop bag now for 2 semesters and it's held up very well to my wear and tear lifestyle. I have a 17 inch laptop and I can still fit folders, a large college textbook and folders as well as several other small things. This has been a staple part of my university life since I received it. Best buy ever
customer_reviews.author: _Phaedra_

customer_reviews.title: Love this backpack
customer_reviews.text: Love this backpack, my 17 inches laptop fits perfectly, its so protective and you can put many things inside it I usually have wireless mouse, charger, ruler, wacom tablet, 2 usb cables, skullcandy headphones, external HDD. Also bought one for my Nikon D5200 camera, and will definitely buy this brand forever!! Actually Im thinking to get the LAPTOP-CAMERA bag.
customer_reviews.author: Nathanael Varela

customer_reviews.title: Great--Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy, well-made, and logical. It comfortably fits my large laptop, charger, cell phone and charger, headphones, and two tables without being bulky or tough to carry. Also has room for other personal items. I'm a writer who is on-the-go and this is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Getting a little tethered after 4yrs. of use but ...
customer_reviews.text: Getting a little tethered after 4yrs. of use but has been essential for carrying not only the now second laptop but notebook stand with cooling fan, usb powered speakers, ac charging adapter for laptop, and even a separate trackball mouse to save on wear&tear of touchpad.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Chase

customer_reviews.title: Great Computer Backpack
customer_reviews.text: This backpack really fits my oversized computer with lots of extra pockets for accessories and folders. Given the price I was pleasantly surprised at the quality and durability of this item. I used it once on a trip and plan on using it for a long time as my computer is new, and I have confidence that it will last. I also like a backpack style as it keeps my hands free for other luggage items.
customer_reviews.author: Tim in OP

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag. Use it for 2 of my laptops. No a whole lot of pockets. Good for laptop and charging chord. Can't beat the price. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Martinez Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Well made with many compartments
customer_reviews.text: This is a great back backpack for a laptop. It is well made and has many compartments for various items besides the laptop. It's easy to get on and off, even when it is stuffed with things. I have had it for some time now and it shows no wear at all. I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Waterman

customer_reviews.title: Way better than my last briefcase.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a backpack as I was fed up with my old brief case cutting into my shoulders due tot he slim straps, this bag has wonderful wide straps with padding which makes the bag easy to wear and comfortable when it is on. The bag fits my 17inch screen laptop easily and has loads of space for charger, tablet etc. Great buy that I wish I had bought earlier.
customer_reviews.author: I. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: I really love how comfortable and padded the back and straps are
customer_reviews.text: Holds my 17.3" laptop with plenty of room. The other pockets hold just about anything you would want. I really love how comfortable and padded the back and straps are. Not really a backpack person but love this for my laptop and stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Principalkathy

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: I looked high and low for a good laptop backpack that wouldn't break the bank. After three years, I still LOVE this bag and it has taken a beating! My laptop fits great and so do most of my heavy college books. The padded interior computer pocket is great and the front pocket has plenty of room for pens, pencils, calculators, earbuds...whatever. The middle pocket holds books, notebooks, folders etc. Will continue to use it and buy more for other family members!
customer_reviews.author: C.E.V.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This Laptop bag is amazing, I use this everyday for work and school, easily holds 2 laptops I had this bag for over 5 years and have to say it is amazing, I carry so many heavy items and it took the load easily while still being comfortable. Over the 5 years it did wear out, but worth buying again for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Gyandeo Bajnath

customer_reviews.title: Distributes the weight nicely - my shoulder bag was killing me
customer_reviews.text: Big enough for my books and snacks, as well as my 17-inch laptop. Distributes the weight nicely - my shoulder bag was killing me, but this doesn't seem heavy at all with the same contents.
customer_reviews.author: ARG

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty good pack
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good pack, the computer pocket just fit's my 17in. My only complaint would be the secondary pockets be a bit larger for accessories. Overall I'm very happy with it. Well made and durable so far.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Highberger

customer_reviews.title: The quality and price is good.
customer_reviews.text: The quality and price is good. I have been using this bag for 2 years. I hope I can use a few more years. I am very happy with it. I carry my macBook. I sometimes use while I am traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Yalcin

customer_reviews.title: BEST BOOKBAG EVER
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag more than any other bag i've owned. it's comfortable and takes most of the pressure off of my neck and shoulders, which makes everything i carry feel lighter. i carry my huge laptop in it, as well as a textbook and 2 notebooks, 2 sketchbooks, and a million pens and pencils as well as my chargers for my phone and laptop. i even slip some lunch in there from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Isobel

customer_reviews.title: Useful and Professional
customer_reviews.text: For $25, this bag is much more than what I expected it to be. It's sleek and fits my 17-inch laptop like a charm. Love the fact that it has three slots: one for the laptop, one for books, and one for stationery. Was a tad disappointed with the way it looks but then there's only so much you can get for that price. It's not a fashion statement, but it's definitely looks professional and is useful.
customer_reviews.author: AncientAstronaut

product_meta.title: Case Logic VNB-217BLACK Value 17-Inch Laptop Backpack (Black)
product_meta.description: Size:Size 17| Color:BlackStreamlined styling and smartly placed features add up to a minimalist footprint. Sized to fit laptops with up to 17 inch displays with practical organization for everything else you need to carry.
feature_bullets: Dedicated, 3/4 zip laptop compartment holds up to 17" widescreen laptops
Speed Pocket- A quick access, secure place to put valuables (watch, keys, cell phone etc.) prior to passing through airport security
Fits devices: 16.4 x 11.8 x 1.8 in. Item dimensions is 12.4 x 8.5 x 18.5 in inches. Volume is 1575 cubic inch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,644 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
